To fight off a California dust bowl, the state will pay farmers to reimagine idle land

Gov. Gavin Newsom and legislators set aside $50 million in this year’s budget for a new program to help farmers repurpose land for new uses, such as wildlife habitat or groundwater recharge basins. The effort comes as a water shortage is forcing California farmers to leave unprecedented amounts of their land unplanted.
